text:
If you’re interested in contributing we have a lot of little tasks.

Here are the tasks needed to get us to Version 1.0
<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft/milestone/1>

no contribution is too small.

There’s literally an issue for reviewing if we need recommended.css anymore and an issue for if we need clearfix css anymore. At most that’s 1 line of code to actually change each.
Upvotes appreciated on this idea post as it would significantly help <#CCQSQ2C6L|crankshaft>
another submission for the Logo Challenge
Feedback is highly appreciated :slightly_smiling_face:
oooOOOooo
Definitely dig the iconography, but I think I prefer the typography of <@U7AS8L4MR>'s submission. I really like how it looks like a grid system though

didn’t even think about the fact it looks like a grid system, while still looking like a crankshaft. that’s a cool thought.

Think I agree about the typography, different font, maybe the one that Jon used, but really I almost think a boxier looking font may look better with it, but idk
There are a bunch of "automotive" font options out there as well. DDC Hardware off the top of my head might be a good place to start
ok i will try it with that one
Updated with the suggested font DDC Hardware
good suggestion looks a lot better
an more coherend

I like the look of this. I think the Kearning on the font needs some adjustment though as that is a powerful bolded font so some additional letterspacing might help with legibility on it. Only gripe with the font is when its small like the way it looks above, the R's and A's look almost identical if you squint so people with poor vision might not be able to see them.
Hi AJ, thanks for this valuable feedback! Indeed i used the condensed version of the font. i will try with the normal one.
while it did help with the kerning, obviously the other Problem with R and A still remains
anarchy sign for a's?
that'll do it
these look great, btw
thanks dennis
he was joking, meant something like that :point_down::skin-tone-2:
ok
:slightly_smiling_face:
never take me seriously
:smile:
except when i compliment you
:slightly_smiling_face:
here's another idea. playing off the crankshaft symbol and integrating the C and S from crankshaft in the logo. i used HubSpot colors, but those could definitely change.
that’s definitely interesting
it reminds me of the SUN Logo, i like the concept really interesting
hard to get the CS interpretation without it being vertical though
i agree with Jon
true. its more visible when it's vertical.
it could be our little easter egg
(I'm over here trying to figure out how many cylinders that engine would have lmao)
lol be more abstract have the c be a light gray, have the s be dark gray and it wouldn’t be immediately obvious
i think the pistons are between or on those bars so either 3 or 5 :smile:
i'm a developer, not an auto mechanic.
ditto. scroll up to see the fact I didn’t realize pistons were involved in the crankshaft

irony is my dad’s been a mechanic for as long as I’ve lived, and he once tried to get me interested in it.(it failed, went into computers)

Funny tidbit, when he retired, he told me in similar words to this “I honestly thought you were screwed when all you wanted to do was play on the computer as a kid.  Didn’t know a dang thing about cars. After busting knuckles for 40 years, I’m proud to say you didn’t make the same choice as me.”
yeah those were different times..
40 years from now we might look at ourselfs thinking  “why did we do that ”
:smile:
when we all will be dominated by an AI Overlord

lol my future kids will be like collecting large sample sets of data, and I’ll be like “you’re using all our hard drive space, stop it.” just to find out they’re a machine learning genius when the grow up, making things to put me out of a job
sorry to derail the awesome logo discussion haha
btw i forgot to mention that i am still open to color and font changes, so if anyone has a suggestion, please let me know.
If you want to match the HubSpot app colors (and who doesn’t) here is the list of ones in HubSpot’s Canvas design language <https://canvas.HubSpot.com/styles/colors>
i have taken the colors from this site
Awesome

In terms of the icon itself, I really like it.  Only thing is I was thinking about introducing some “border-radius” into each shaft to make it look a bit more round like the real the thing usually is.  Not super opinionated on that but wanted to throw that out there
A Version with rounded corners <@UFBNA9K9A>
Love it, i think all that would need to be done is cleaning up the borders a bit
those are intented white borders on to make it look like it isn not one huge chunk of metal :slightly_smiling_face:
but you are correct i will have to find a better solution for that
I like the direction of the brandmark <@UBT0AHWLD>, for me personally the typeface and name are a little understated.  So here is an quick idea of combining our concepts.
you are correct, it is understated, i really love the combination
i am really impressed at the progress that we all made with those logo submissions from everyone. And the colaboration, that is what i love about those kind of projects
all in a matter of hours
Screw the vote, that combo by <@U7AS8L4MR> and <@UBT0AHWLD> wins.
love it
agreed
I like the orange version myself, draws my attention more
maybe give the icon a little breathing room to the right?

for sure, this was just a quick throw togeather since I don’t actually have the vector of <@UBT0AHWLD>’s brandmark.  If this is for sure the final winner ill be happy to go thru and finalize all the spacings etc. and throw a quick brand standards document together for it
Orange version for sure
so cool

Guys, I have to say, I am so happy about the community involvement in this project so far, it’s super exciting. I think we’re going to do some really awesome things with it and it’s going to make all of our lives easier/better
Should we say screw waiting till friday and do a vote on the logo?
sounds good I’ll get a poll up just trying to get all the options set

(you can vote for your own or another person’s even if you submitted a logo)
Unrelated, if you’re looking for an easy task to get your feet wet in contributing <https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft/issues/29>

my apologies, <@UBT0AHWLD> logo is this one: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/UBT0AHWLD/FJHK82SBW/bildschirmfoto_2019-05-08_um_22.40.58.jpg>
accidentally included wrong link
No rebels in the mix it would appear
I’ll leave the poll going for the night I guess. (let some east hemisphere people have a chance lol)  tomorrow we’ll declare the winner by noon CST or sooner if Ikes has a decisive lead like it has
i got you <@UD53A9UUR>
Huzzah!
